page.title: 16Recreation
page.content: The villages of Cliffe and Hemingbrough are able to offer a variety of leisure activities. Both have public houses where a range of in-door games such as darts and dominoes are played.The village institutes offer facilities for whist and beetle drives and occasional Bingo sessions. Outdoors, there are playing fields with swings, slide and roundabout. At Cliffe there is a flourishing tennis club with membership open to anyone interested in playing the game.Both villages have football and cricket clubs. For individual leisure there is gardening and in 1986 there is to be a Best Kept Garden competition. For swimming, theatre and cinema people have to travel.A Video library visits each village daily.
